title: Walnut Pasta

ingredients.ingredient: Salt and ground black pepper, to taste

instructions: In a nonstick skillet over medium-low heat, heat the oil.
Add the nuts and cook, stirring frequently, for 3 to 4 minutes.
Add the garlic, spinach, basil, salt, and pepper.
Cook, stirring frequently, for 3 to 5 minutes, or until the spinach wilts.
Toss with warm cooked pasta and top with cheese.

source.citation: Irvine, H. M. (2018). The Runner's World Vegetarian Cookbook. New York: Rodale Books.
source.title: The Runner's World Vegetarian Cookbook

description: A quick protein- and carb-packed lunch
title: Smoky Black Bean Grilled Cheese

ingredients.ingredient: jarred roasted red bell pepper, sliced

instructions: Top 1 slice of the bread with the black beans, roasted pepper, cheese, and avocado.
Cover with the second bread slice.
In a skillet over medium-low heat, melt the butter.
Add the sandwich and cook, turning once, until both sides are crispy and the cheese has melted.

source.citation: Irvine, H. M. (2018). The Runner's World Vegetarian Cookbook. New York: Rodale Books.
source.title: The Runner's World Vegetarian Cookbook

description: A filling and easy vegan entrée
title: Lemon Pepper Tofu

ingredients.ingredient: extra-firm tofu (do not use silken tofu)

instructions: Freeze the tofu overnight
In the morning, move it to the fridge to thaw
Mix all ingredients but tofu in a large bowl
Cut tofu into 6 slices
Coat both sides of the tofu with the lemon pepper sauce you created
Bake for 20 minutes at 375° F
Flip the tofu
Bake for an additional 20 minutes

source.citation: Roche, B. (2021, January 5). Lemon Pepper Tofu Cutlets.
source.title: Original recipe

description: A vegetarian take on classic chicken parm
title: Tofu Parmesan
instructions: Slice tofu into eight equal pieces.
Press the slices of tofu.
In a small mixing bowl, mix panko crumbs with Italian seasoning and garlic salt.
In a separate small mixing bowl, mix together water and flour.
In a frying pan on medium-high heat, pour a thin layer of oil. Allow it to get hot.
For each slice of tofu: dip into the flour/water mixture, then coat heavily in panko.
Lightly fry each slice of tofu for a minute or on each side, until golden-brown and crispy.
Coat each slice with marinara sauce.
Sprinkle each slice with cheese.
Place in the oven on low broil until cheese is melted.

source.citation: Six Vegan Sisters. (2018). Crispy Tofu Parm Sandwich.
source.title: Original recipe

description: A vegan take on a southern classic
title: "Chicken" and Biscuits

ingredients.ingredient: vegan soy curls, rehydrated in broth, drained & pressed dry with paper towels

instructions: In 2 cups of very hot broth, add the soy curls and allow to sit for at least 10 minutes.
Drain, reserving the broth, and press the curls with paper towels to remove some of the excess moisture.
Add oil, onion, carrots and celery to a large saute pan, cook until vegetables are tender.
Add garlic; cook and stir 1 minute longer.
Add the drained soy curls to the vegetables and cook until golden and browned.
Stir in 1/4 cup flour to the mixture until blended.
Gradually add stock with bouillon (including the reserved 2 cups used to soak the soy curls), stirring constantly.
Stir in sugar and add bay leaves.
Cook, covered, until mixture reaches a simmer.
Meanwhile for the drop biscuits, whisk together flour, baking powder and salt.
Add oatmilk and melted vegan margarine, mixing just until blended (do not over mix). Set aside.
Gently stir in oatmilk, parsley and thyme.
Season with additional salt and pepper to taste.
Discard bay leaves.
Drop large scoops of dumpling/biscuit batter on top of simmering soup.
Reduce heat to low; cook, covered (do not lift cover for 15-18 minutes).
To check for doneness, insert a toothpick in center of dumplings. It should come out clean when fully cooked.

source.citation: The Veg Life!. (2019). Vegan Chicken and Biscuits
source.title: Original recipe
